definition: adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack
to bind/bunch/bundle/classifier for bunches, bundles, beams of light etc/to control

sentences.english: She looks ridiculous in that getup.
sentences.chinese: 她那套装束看起来很可笑。

sentences.english: But he still dresses like a cowboy because the garb is practical;
sentences.chinese: 但是他仍然穿的像一个牛仔，因为这个装束很实用。

sentences.english: Everyone knows that attitudes toward work attire have relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 都知道，人们对职场装束的态度变得随意了。

sentences.english: Are you comfortable in your getup and equipment?
sentences.chinese: 而你的装束和设备舒服吗？

sentences.english: Everything about her was matter-of-fact: her manner, her gestures, her dress.
sentences.chinese: 她的态度，举止和装束，她的一切都很平淡。

sentences.english: This outfit does not endear me to shopkeepers.
sentences.chinese: 我的这身装束总让店主对我爱理不理。

sentences.english: Her costume was so good, that I didn't recognize my own girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 我都认不出自己的女朋友了，她的装束太棒了。

sentences.english: But Sarah Palin is still expected to be a popular choice.
sentences.chinese: 但是佩琳的装束估计会成为抢手货。

sentences.english: Incidentally, the Topcoat-plus-Skirt style was also very popular during this period.
sentences.chinese: 另外，上袄下裙的打扮，也是这时期女子的流行装束。

sentences.english: Your coat, hat, and shoes make an attractive ensemble.
sentences.chinese: 你的上衣和鞋帽这全套装束很吸引人。

sentences.english: To make this easier, wear a two-piece outfit that day.
sentences.chinese: 为了更方便，那天可以穿一套两件套的装束。

sentences.english: Perhaps; but in that attire it was not apparent.
sentences.chinese: 也许，但由于那种装束，她并不显得美。

sentences.english: Such civil belly dance the most eye-catching is that it abnormal China and the United States and in full gear.
sentences.chinese: 这种民间肚皮舞最吸引人眼球的是它华美异常的装束。

sentences.english: A man appeared at the castle gate in the guise of a woodcutter.
sentences.chinese: 一个樵夫装束的人出现在城堡的大门口。

sentences.english: Fixed a bug where punching a player who was jockeyed would not give them a getup.
sentences.chinese: 修正了一个错误，冲球员骗不给他们一个装束。

sentences.english: May be spring a costume so that teenagers have such idea.
sentences.chinese: 可能是山泉的一身装束让少年有了这样的念头。

definition: to decorate/to adorn/to dress up/to disguise oneself
to decorate/to dress/to make up/to adorn/manner of dressing/style of dress
long gown/cheongsam/traditional Asian dress for men or (in Hong Kong) women's qipao
